data: Iscrizioni, epigrafi ed epigrammi in Greco della Sicilia orientale di epoca romana
Giacomo Manganaro, «Iscrizioni, epigrafi ed epigrammi in Greco della Sicilia orientale di epoca romana», Mélanges de l’École Francaise de Rome: Antiquité 106, fasc. 1 (1994): 79–118

Two non-joining fragments of a marble plaque with Greek letters. The first (Manganaro's second) preserves a moulding on the right and above, preserving an upper right corner, while broken on left and below; the second (Manganaro's first) is broken on all sides, but shows a division between two columns of text, and as Manganaro rightly notes should come from lower down in the text therefore. Manganaro suggests these are fragments from a stele, given the form and the moulding. Fragment (a) is H 14 cm x W 9 cm; fragment b is H 10.5 x W 7.
Both fragments show empty lines and vacats at line ends, and fragment b has an incised line apparently separating two columns of text.
Lunate epsilon and sigma, straight bar alpha, uncial omega.
Jonathan Prag revised from published edition
Manganaro, 1994, Iscrizioni, epigrafi ed epigrammi in Greco della Sicilia orientale di epoca romana
